resources.string: the guy above me is annoying
Im the only one to separate siamese twins

string-array.name: ClintonDescription
string-array.item: First Lady and wife to Bill Clinton

string-array.name: ClintonStrategy
string-array.item: Her campaign is funded by individual and private donors and have raised over $76B. Leading in current polls, Hillary is running President for the second time after being overtaken by Barack Obama in 2008
Targeted women and youth voters in ads and talk shows and holds herself as the champion of everyday Americans
Downplay the e-mail and Benghazi scandals that have plagued her campaign
Huge advantage in Florida over Sanders, but must actively keep her close leads in Iowa and Wisconsin

string-array.name: ClintonEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Cut Middle Class taxes, raise taxes on wealthy
Supports increasing the salaries of the middle class people
Supports a more potent Capital Gains Tax over time
Wants to monitor Wall St. Banks, only break up "Too Big to Fail" banks if risky
Currently does not support Trans-Pacific Partnership which cuts trade barriers, protects multinational corporations\' intellectual properties and sets labor and environmental standards

string-array.name: ClintonSocialIssues
string-array.item: Marijuana legalization should be tested by the states before being federally enacted
Against absolute right to gun ownership

string-array.name: ClintonForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Russia must work to help Syria, not cause chaos
Will not hesitate to use military force against Iran to prevent nuclear acquisition
Vowed to preserve Israel\'s military by renewing security package ($3 billion per year in aid)
Drastically escalate of arming Syrians against Assad

string-array.name: ClintonFaults
string-array.item: Political Expediency depending on where she campaigns (Trade Deal "gold standard")

string-array.name: ClintonRecord
string-array.item: Voted in favor of war in Iraq
Supported sending resources in Libya but no active fighting
Voted pro on $60 billion stimulus package
Voted against paying down federal debt by cutting programs

string-array.name: SandersStrategy
string-array.item: Reach across the aisle; it\'s easy to talk to people who agree, but harder to talk with people that disagree
Must distinguish himself from Clinton, who as a result is being pulled to the left
Struggling to win over New Hampshire

string-array.name: SandersEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Break up Wall St. Banks, add fees for high-risk investments
Pro Social Security Expansion, Anti Privatization

string-array.name: SandersForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Against US ground troops in Syria
Force is a last resort, when the US or allies are threatened

string-array.name: SandersFaults
string-array.item: Softer than other DNC candidates on Gun control
Voted against tax cuts for small business in 2000
Slightly to the right of Democrats in Foreign Policy

string-array.name: SandersRecord
string-array.item: Voted against Brady Bill five times
Voted against Iraq and Gulf war
Voted for the war in Afghanistan
Voted for embryonic stem cell research

item.b: Lincoln Chafee has dropped out of Democratic primary race

string-array.name: ChafeeFaults
string-array.item: Democrat for two years prior to being Republican and Independent
Voted for growth of big banks when starting on Senate floor, later regret

string-array.name: OMalleyStrategy
string-array.item: Significantly stood out in first DNC debate for a green energy plan
Comprehensive plans on Wall Street reform, debt-free college, climate change, immigration reform
Challenged other Democratic nominees to offer a framework on Wall St. reform as robust as his own
Quick to roll out plans, tries to be first
Attack Clinton for closeness to Wall St. and scandals

string-array.name: OMalleyEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Reinstate Glass-Steagall (limits commercial bank investments and insurance)
Fight banks that are too big to fail
Raise minimum wage to $10 per hour
Cut taxes on bottom 85% while raising taxes on top 15%

string-array.name: OMalleySocialIssues
string-array.item: Plan to make America 100% clean electric by 2050
Long time opponent of capital punishment
Proportionality in marijuana arrests, but not legalization. No legalization in Maryland, watch Colorado experiment
Strongly supports pathway to citizenship for illegal aliens

string-array.name: OMalleyForeignPolicy
string-array.item: No Fly Zone in Syria would be unenforceable, will cause escalation against Russia
Opposes bad trade deals like Trans-Pacific Partnership
Two-state solution between Israel and Palestine
Negotiate with Iran to remove potential nuclear weapons

string-array.name: OMalleyFaults
string-array.item: Criticized for Maryland\'s increase in violence
Outlier in wishing to expand the military
Private GMail account that is technically legal, but still criticized as against "the spirit of the law"
Widely unpopular tax raises in Maryland caused Republican revolution

string-array.name: OMalleyRecord
string-array.item: Repealed property tax on small business
Voted for a Wind-Powered Generating Station

item.b: Jim Webb has withdrawn from the Democratic primary race to run as an independent

string-array.name: WebbStrategy
string-array.item: Displays to voters strong foreign policy

string-array.name: WebbSocialIssues
string-array.item: Claims Affirmative Action is racist against whites, but distinguishes black affirmative action from nonwhite affirmative action

string-array.name: TrumpDescription
string-array.item: Chairman of Trump Atlantic City Associates

string-array.name: TrumpStrategy
string-array.item: Using his own money to fund his campaign
Pull strings of those who he had given money to
Considered running on the same ticket as Carson
Looking to distance himself from Carson after being overtaken in Iowa
Wants to win as a Republican, but will run as Independent

string-array.name: TrumpEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Dump weight of ObamaCare and increase insurance competition

string-array.name: TrumpSocialIssues
string-array.item: Gay marriage is a state issue
Against Common Core, cut Department of Education

string-array.name: TrumpForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Build a wall along the Mexican border, make Mexico\'s government pay for it
Deal with North Korean nuclear threat

string-array.name: TrumpFaults
string-array.item: Ridiculed over claim that vaccines cause autism
Pegged as misogynistic, racist, and Islamophobic
Criticizes opponents\' looks, retaliation targets hair
Not taken seriously by many news outlets

string-array.name: CarsonStrategy
string-array.item: Surged past Trump in two Iowa polls
Carson is the only one to separate siamese twins
Must work harder to attract declining black support

string-array.name: CarsonSocialIssues
string-array.item: Against abortion after 20 weeks, no abortion for convenience
Supports gay rights, but not marriage
Pro medical marijuana, against recreational use

string-array.name: CarsonForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Back Israel, obey Netanyahu over Iran

string-array.name: CarsonFaults
string-array.item: Claimed ObamaCare is the worst thing since slavery
Received backlash for comparing gays to pedophilia and bestiality
Mild mannered speaking (political opposite of shouting)

string-array.name: FiorinaStrategy
string-array.item: Must portray her leadership at HP as economically sufficient
Losing edge as non-politician as poll numbers fall

string-array.name: FiorinaEconomyPlans
string-array.item: State minimum wage more logical than Federal minimum wage, as economic conditions vary by location
Eliminate estate tax and capital gains taxes for investments and small businesses as well as marginal tax rates

string-array.name: FiorinaSocialIssues
string-array.item: Pro-life after 20 weeks, except for rape, incest, or danger to the life of mother
Acknowledged existence of climate change by human activity, but government cannot change issue
Against legalizing marijuana, but up to states
Paid maternity leave should be voluntary

string-array.name: FiorinaFaults
string-array.item: HP board of directors forced Fiorina to resign as CEO due to declining stock value, low earning reports, and resistance to transferring authority
Controversial acquisition of Compaq Computer while at HP
Blamed failures at HP on glass ceiling, later rescind

string-array.name: FiorinaRecord
string-array.item: Voted for Proposition 8 in 2009, which banned gay marriage in CA

string-array.name: RubioDescription
string-array.item: Speaker of the Florida House of Representative

string-array.name: RubioStrategy
string-array.item: Carried out American Dream from humble origins
The best way to get known is through his tax plan

string-array.name: RubioEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Simplified 2-bracket tax code: 15% under and 35% over $75,000
Give minimum wage subsidies, not raise minimum wage
Grow the middle class, not government
Extend Bush tax cuts, even for wealthy
No one should pay higher taxes in recession
Replace all property taxes by adding 2.5% to sales tax
Supports Taxpayer Protection Pledge, or a pledge to oppose any and all tax increases
Tax-free zones in downtrodden inner-city areas

string-array.name: RubioSocialIssues
string-array.item: Argues human activity does not play a major role in global warming
Tax breaks for businesses that offer employees paid family leave
Less federal and more local control of education

string-array.name: RubioForeignPolicy
string-array.item: More liberty for the Cuban people
Private assistance to Jordan to prepare for ISIS
Use US air support for Sunni forces fighting ISIS
Denuclearize the peninsula and unify it

string-array.name: RubioFaults
string-array.item: Rubio-Lee tax plan criticized by both Republicans and Democrats as harmful fpr the deficit
Attacked for dismal personal finances and debt
Allegations of using party credit cards for personal use without full reimbursement

string-array.name: RubioRecord
string-array.item: Voted against Violence Against Women Act stating he largely supported it but objected to certain provisions
Voted against funding stem cell research
Voted against protecting ocean, coastal, and Great Lakes ecosystems
Voted against authorizing states to collect Internet sales taxes
Voted for the restricted EPA from regulating greenhouse gases
Voted for the Ryan Budget: Medicare choice, tax and spending cuts

string-array.name: BushStrategy
string-array.item: Must win in New Hampshire primary

string-array.name: BushEconomyPlans
string-array.item: No national sales tax or VAT

string-array.name: BushSocialIssues
string-array.item: Restrict abortions to incest, rape, and health
Build XL pipeline and embrace energy revolution
Supports Common Core, contrary to GOP

string-array.name: BushForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Give Israel weapons to intimidate Iran
Expand US troops in countries near Russia
Called ISIS a result of Iraq withdrawal

string-array.name: BushFaults
string-array.item: Openly admitted to having smoked marijuana
Received criticism from Trump over Mexican wife influencing relaxed immigration stance
Criticized for speaking Spanish at certain campaign spots
Criticized for stating Illegal Immigration is an Act of Love

string-array.name: CruzStrategy
string-array.item: Behind in New Hampshire and South Carolina

string-array.name: CruzEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Supports market recovery instead of stimulus

string-array.name: CruzForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Bomb ISIS back to the Stone Age

string-array.name: CruzFaults
string-array.item: Tweeted insult joke against Biden during mourning

string-array.name: CruzRecord
string-array.item: Voted against Violence Against Women Act

string-array.name: KasichEconomyPlans
string-array.item: No income taxes on small businesses up to $2 million
Relieve student debt with $120 million fund
$3 billion in tax cuts for job creators

string-array.name: KasichSocialIssues
string-array.item: Raise tax on oil and gas

string-array.name: KasichForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Focus on terrorism, oil, and nuclear development

string-array.name: KasichRecord
string-array.item: Voted for ending preferential treatment by race in college admissions
Voted for reducing Social Security benefits
Voted for $46 billion in tax cuts for small businesses
Voted against withdrawing from the WTO

string-array.name: HuckabeeStrategy
string-array.item: Twitter against Hillary Clinton and DNC
Very heavy appeal to the religious

string-array.name: HuckabeeEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Fight Wall St.\'s control of Washington
Help blacks fight racism and unequal opportunity in job market
FairTax to remove IRS and sift power back to states

string-array.name: HuckabeeSocialIssues
string-array.item: Does not believe in climate change
Do not allow kids to listen to toxic music like Beyonce
Let illegal immigrant kids in college despite parents\' crime

string-array.name: HuckabeeFaults
string-array.item: Under fire from Republicans for supporting Kim Davis after Supreme Court ruling

string-array.name: ChristieStrategy
string-array.item: Focus on New Jersey job growth

string-array.name: ChristieEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Do not raise minimum wage, create better-paying jobs
Simplify tax code to three brackets, the highest at 28%

string-array.name: ChristieSocialIssues
string-array.item: Against gay marriage, but will obey the law
Rewrite tax system to bring back corporations from overseas
Used to support Common Core, now regret
Against gun control except from law-enforcement perspective
No pathway to citizenship, but college tuition for illegals

string-array.name: ChristieForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Send American troops to fight ISIL
Do not pull troops out of Afghanistan

string-array.name: ChristieFaults
string-array.item: Turns off Republican voters with blowhard speaking
Abysmal approval rating towards end of term

string-array.name: PaulStrategy
string-array.item: Hitch onto the popularity of Ron Paul

string-array.name: PaulEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Cut corporate tax in half to create millions of jobs
Economic freedom zones or low taxes in high unemployment areas

string-array.name: PaulSocialIssues
string-array.item: Against marijuana legalization, but in favor of medical and industrial hemp

string-array.name: PaulForeignPolicy
string-array.item: America has little involvement in ISIS

string-array.name: PaulRecord
string-array.item: Voted against Violence Against Women Act
Voted against protecting ocean, coastal, and Great Lakes ecosystems
Voted for barring EPA from regulating greenhouse gases

string-array.name: JindalStrategy
string-array.item: Struggle to make the debate stage

string-array.name: JindalEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Allow stockholder voting on executive compensation

string-array.name: JindalSocialIssues
string-array.item: HealthCare is a right but instrument is the marketplace
Build a fence along Mexican border

string-array.name: JindalForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Deter foreign arms transfers to China
Reform the UN by restricting US funding

string-array.name: JindalRecord
string-array.item: Voted against $84 million in grants for Black and Hispanic colleges
Voted against Central America Free Trade
Voted for increasing minimum wage to $7.25

string-array.name: SantorumStrategy
string-array.item: Previously spoken in all 99 counties of Iowa

string-array.name: SantorumEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Opposed Wall St. and Auto bailout
Fannie and Freddie should create housing affordability
Reduce corporate tax to flat rate of 20%
Fewer than 1% of Americans earn minimum wage; let it go up
20/20 tax plan: all income trated the same

string-array.name: SantorumSocialIssues
string-array.item: Get government out of our school
401(k) approach would provide better benefits than Social Security

string-array.name: SantorumForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Assassinate Iranian and North Korean nuclear scientists
Send US troops to combat ISIS

string-array.name: SantorumRecord
string-array.item: Voted for $40 billion in reduced federal overall spending
Voted for prioritizing national debt reduction below tax cuts
Voted for defunding renewable and solar energy
Voted for approving nuclear waste repository

string-array.name: GrahamEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Cut spending to raise debt ceiling

string-array.name: GrahamSocialIssues
string-array.item: Greenhouse gas is a problem, but EPA should not regulate
Build a fence along the Mexican border

string-array.name: GrahamRecord
string-array.item: Voted against Violence Against Women Act

string-array.name: PatakiStrategy
string-array.item: Play the "Trump Card" to get noticed

string-array.name: PatakiSocialIssues
string-array.item: Pro-choice, but ban abortion after 20 weeks
Opposes gay marriage but supports gay and lesbian rights
Invest in math and science innovation
Set goal of 25% renewable energy by 2025
Immigrants may come to work, go easy on immigrant children

string-array.name: PatakiRecord
string-array.item: Voted to cut off Medicaid abortion funding

string-array.name: GilmoreStrategy
string-array.item: Gilmore entered the race late in the game
Has not held formal campaign events with actual voters
No handshakes in Iowa, rallies in New Hampshire, or kickoff rally

string-array.name: GilmoreEconomyPlans
string-array.item: Right to abortion in the first 8-12 weeks of pregnancy
Income tax 25%, business tax 15%, death tax 0%
Undecided on FairTax and flat tax

string-array.name: GilmoreSocialIssues
string-array.item: Praises Bush leadership on Social Security

string-array.name: GilmoreForeignPolicy
string-array.item: Create a Middle East NATO to fight both Iran and ISIL
Pursue terrorists into Pakistan, but maintain secrecy

string-array.name: GilmoreRecord
string-array.item: In favor of raising teacher pay
